segments.text: The problem is to compute for each vertex i in a tree with n vertices (n is odd), the number of trees where i is the centroid. The trees are constructed such that for each i>1, it has exactly one parent with a smaller index. The centroid is a node whose removal leaves all subtrees with size at most (n-1)/2.
